  17. This is a great product. I have long, VERY thick (I clog the shower drain every time I shower because I shed so frequently), coarse hair normally. It's unruly, it frizzes easily, and it's a huge hassle if I don't do something with it and let it dry au naturale. Allow me to walk you through why I believe you should give this product a chance:<br /><br />First there is the smell. It has a vanilla scent with a slight almond undertone. It's very fragrant and will dull out post-shower. The smell is not nauseating to me, and it's hands down a better (and cheaper) product than Wen. (Sorry Wen!)<br />Second, there is the quality. I don't leave it in that very long (about 2 minutes while I shave) and after my hair is very soft. With Wen I had to use it twice and leave it in for an indeterminable amount of time.<br />Third, there is it's magical ability to be used as a leave-in conditioner (I do NOT recommend that ladies or gents with thin hair use this as a leave-in because it may be too heavy for your hair.) I use it as a leave-in and no frizz (I took a hint from Wen) even when it's moist out. (Didn't use it as a leave-in one time and it was a huge mistake!)<br />Fourth, it does help my hair feel different--in a good way!<br /><br />A few hints that may help (science or superstition, I don't know but I think it helps.)<br />* Leave it in while you shave or do other things to give your hair a chance to absorb.<br />* Rinse in cold water (my hair becomes extra shiny when I rinse in cold water!) and, for my thick-haired ladies, add a small amount to your palm and try to spread evenly. (I find that the Wet Paddle Brush helps to spread evenly without pulling, stretching, and breaking wet hair.)<br />* Post shower, do NOT towel dry your hair. It causes breakage and it's not good for your hair. Instead, I recommend the MICROFIBER turbie twist. I love it because it keeps my hair in place, it isn't bulky, it helps the hair absorb moisture while drying, and allows me to focus on the first thing that I work on in the mornings post shower....my facial regimen.<br /><br />Feel free to ask some questions! I'll be happy to help! :-)<br />Please feel free to ask some questions and I'll be happy to reply.<br /><br />*I did not receive free product to try before I purchased this product. That being said, if you post a review after you purchase you can follow the instructions on the card to receive free product. I did notice that there's a difference in coloration in the bottles from the free and purchased product but when I tried the product I got for free I didn't notice any noticeable differences in my hair. I will post pictures of the free product vs. purchased product in a day or so. I will also experiment by using my clarifying shampoo paired with both the free and purchased product and show differences between this and the conditioner by Garnier - Brazilian Smooth and style as normal. I hope that this helps those purchasing! Pictures to come in the next week!*first thing that I work on in the mornings post shower....my facial regimen.<br /><br />Feel free to ask some questions! I'll be happy to help! :-)<br />Please feel free to ask some questions and I'll be happy to reply.<br /><br />*I did not receive free product to try before I purchased this product.   66. I usually don't take the time to write reviews, but I wanted to for this product bc I am so compelled by it. My story is that I have been struggling to find a conditioner that didn't make my hair fall out any more than it should. Several years ago, I realized how damaging certain chemicals were to my hair and skin and thus I got rid of all my drug store bought items and switched to products that were more organic. I immediately noticed a positive difference but it has always been the hair conditioner that has left me still searching for the right one. I had tried so many brands but all of them regardless of how pure the ingredients were still made my hair fall out when it came time to condition it. Thus, I often skipped using a conditioner after washing my hair in the shower. By no means am I having an issue with thinning hair, but still, I don't feel comfortable seeing strands of hair all over my hands while I'm applying the conditioner or seeing a clump remaining in the drain after I've rinsed the conditioner off. And unfortunately, none of the products I had tried (and I'd tried so many, even to the very expensive ones) solved this problem until I found Silk 18 on Amazon. I like to read reviews when I'm shopping and I am so glad I decided to try it. When I tried Silk 18 conditioner for the first time, I kept my expectations low but the result I got was unbelievable!! Not only did it make my hair feel soft and silky, but I was not shedding hair when I was applying it on my hair and after rinsing it off. I noticed maybe 4-5 strands of hair total that fell out but the silky texture of the conditioner did not make me lose any more hair than I naturally would have. My hair was left so soft and nice, yet, I was at ease using it. I wondered maybe the first time was coincidental so I kept using it every other day which is how often I wash my hair. And each time, my hair was left soft and silky without my worrying about excess hair falling out. Thank goodness!! Finally, I have found a hair conditioner that works wonderfully. This is hands down an excellent product and the only hair conditioner I will ever use!! Please don't hesitate to try it for yourself.

  297. This product, honestly and truly, is a miracle product. I know, I know- you've heard it before. You've tried argan oil, conditioning treatments, overnight creams, curl cream, mousse, keratin, coconut oil, and pretty much every brand of shampoo/conditioner on the shelf. LOOK NO FURTHER THAN THIS PRODUCT. First of all, I am including pictures on a review for the first time ever because 1.) obviously, you have to see the before/after difference and 2.) I want you to all be assured that when I say I have poofy hair, I actually mean POOFY HAIR. I straightened my already unruly hair for years and years during middle school/high school/most of college since that was the trend at the time, plus it's often easier to just straighten it and get it out of my face. Often I would cause even more damage by straightening it, and then proceeding to curl it to avoid frizz. On top of all that, I have continuously bleached my hair for more years in a row than I can count (hair dressers hate me for it, but damn I just love being blonde!) Blow drying my hair is a nightmare- unless it's using a diffuser and careful hand movements, don't even think about it. Even using the diffuser didn't really help at all. The only way I could really wear my hair naturally curly was my letting it air dry, and who has TIME for that with how thick our hair is?<br /><br />So, just to sum things up so far, I have been struggling with trying to get defined, soft, natural-looking curls for years. I hesitated to buy this product because nothing else had ever worked, and I didn't want to get my hopes up again. I'm telling you right now- if this worked on my hair texture, I feel extremely confident in saying that you should not be worried about encountering yet another dud product.<br /><br />Silk18 does not feel like your average conditioner when you apply it. You will not immediately be able to run your hands through your hair, and it will not feel silky while it's wet. Though this might sound unappealing, I was actually extremely excited to feel the strange texture because this meant that it really was unlike any other product I've tried. The scent is strong in the shower- there are wonderful vanilla and maple hues, and the scent is just the right amount of subtle when your hair dries (my boyfriend really likes it too!). I appreciated that the small card that comes with the product informs you: &#34;Shampoo is for the scalp, conditioner is for the hair!&#34; This has forever changed the way I will wash my hair. So, I used the shampoo I had (Aussie moisterizing) to my scalp, rinsed, and then I applied Silk18 just before shaving my legs so it could sit for awhile. Then I rinsed the conditioner out with cold water. I wasn't sure how much to use though- I felt like I had to use a bit more than expected to cover my hair, which is fine, but I wish there were bigger bottles available because I might end up running through this one pretty quickly! I then brushed my hair, crimp-dried it with a towel, and then let it air dry. I was so happy with the results!<br /><br />I am including three pictures- the first one (it's a few years old, sorry!) is an example of what happens to my hair when I attempt to blow dry it straight; this is partially for your amusement and partly to show just how annoying it is to try and get ready quickly.<br /><br />The second before is my &#34;before&#34; picture. This was taken after using Aussie shampoo/conditioner, letting my hair dry on its own for a little under an hour, and then using a diffuser to finish drying it. Notice that even though I have really dry hair, the texture is a bit greasy looking. The shape of the curls themselves aren't very consistent at all, and the silhouette of the style is unusual (flat in some places, voluminous in others).<br /><br />The third is my &#34;after&#34; picture! Silk18 makes my hair look less brassy, and evened out the shape of the curls and made them much bouncier. I think it's important to say that the top of my hair is EXTREMELY damaged from bleaching/straightening- the curls underneath formed thick, perfect ringlets and looked even better than my top layer...so even though I know it still looks very poofy to some, just know that this is seriously such a huge improvement for me. My hope is that this product will allow me to stop relying on a straightener so that my hair can heal- I will be updating this post later to update you guys on how the top layer looks after using this product in place of a straightener for awhile, and whether my relationship with blow dryers has improved! I am also eager to try out the shampoo products from this company now that I've seen what the conditioner can do; I hope there are other conditioning treatments available in the future.<br /><br />Thanks for reading about my experience, and I hope this works out as well for you as it did for me! THANK YOU MAPLE HOLISTICS!<br /><br />UPDATE: Added a couple more pictures (fourth and fifth) after trying a new hair styling routine. I DID NOT brush my hair before squeezing it with a towel, and then I used a diffuser (this product works with a blowdryer!!!) after spraying OGX's Weightless Healing Oil Mist into my damp hair. WOW what a difference! Now I am even more pleased with Silk18, this stuff is such a life saver!f my hair is EXTREMELY damaged from bleaching/straightening- the curls underneath formed thick, perfect ringlets and looked even better than my top layer...so even though I know it still looks very poofy to some, just know that this is seriously such a huge improvement for me. My hope is that this product will allow me to stop relying on a straightener so that my hair can heal- I will be updating this post later to update you guys on how the top layer looks after using this product in place of a straightener for awhile, and whether my relationship with blow dryers has improved! I am also eager to try out the shampoo products from this company now that I've seen what the conditioner can do; I hope there are other conditioning treatments available in the future.<br /><br />Thanks for reading about my experience, and I hope this works out as well for you as it did for me! THANK YOU MAPLE HOLISTICS!<br /><br />UPDATE: Added a couple more pictures (fourth and fifth) after trying a new hair styling routine. I DID NOT brush my hair before squeezing it with a towel, and then I used a diffuser (this product works with a blowdryer!!!) after spraying OGX's Weightless Healing Oil Mist into my damp hair. WOW what a difference! Now I am even more pleased with Silk18, this stuff is such a life saver!

As a middle-aged male with thinning hair, however, this conditioner does not do anything to thicken the hair. Not sure that it even adds volume over what any conditioner claims to do. But I will say it does make hair very smooth and shiny, which feels great when the hair dries.<br /><br />The bottle is disappointingly small and quite pricey (per ounce) compared to my normal 20-33 ounce bottles of thickener conditioner, so I am using this conditioner once or twice a week.

I do not like to over wash my hair or use products that have harsh chemicals. I wanted to get quite a few washes in before I left a review so I can give an honest opinion of the product.<br /><br />Despite some reviews, I enjoy the smell. It is not overbearing for me and after it is rinsed out it leaves a slight scent. The first time I used this product and felt it in my hair I understood why they call it silk, it felt amazing! I could run my fingers through my hair and really get it worked in. I leave it on for about 5 minutes each time I use it. My hair does not feel dry or brittle, it does not leave my hair feeling oily, and there is a slight shine when it is fully dried (air dried). I really enjoy the conditioner, however, for me I feel like I need a shampoo to pair it with in order to gain the full benefits of the product. For some people this conditioner alone works just fine, but for my hair I feel like I need a little bit more (I usually always use a shampoo conditioner combo for full effect). I really do enjoy the product and will purchase a shampoo (I don't know which one yet) and I will update and also leave a separate review on the shampoo (it will most likely be another month before I update).<br /><br />Why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5: Since it is winter where I am I can not say how well it will work when the hot humid summer is in full swing. The price is what is expected for a product with quality ingredients and I like the smell. It is only because I want to see how it holds up in the summer that I gave it 4 out of 5 stars.<br /><br />*EDIT: check out my review of the Argan Oil shampoo. I put on the conditioner and left it in for a few minutes and my hair softened up a good bit, but it did not feel silky and it left me with lots of tangles to get out. However, it wasn't that hard to get out the knots, just a few extra minutes. I let my hair dry naturally and it turned out really soft and light and shiny. I have very fine, wavy hair so this conditioner may do better on coarser hair or even no straight hair.<br /><br />Someone on another review mentioned price and I agree that it's pricey at the &#34;full&#34; price. If you diy you know that beauty/skin care ingredients - depending on what they are - are actually quite cheap and that only a little is used in a product. This, for instance, is mostly coconut oil and water, with shea butter and a few other oils. Honestly, if you're paying a ton for any beauty product, you're wasting your money.

I really do. :[<br /><br />After letting this conditioner sit in my hair for about 20 mins, i was impressed with how soft and silky it made my hair feel even while rinsing. But within the next few hours and overnight, I had large red welts and a rash around my jawline, chin and next to my ears. I have read the ingredients over and over and really do not know how or why this happens. i just know that I will not be buying it again. I liked how it made my hair feel, but having a quick reaction usually means something is in this that may not be pointed out. :[<br /><br />I also don't like being asked to review this positively to receive free items. :\<br /><br />**************Edited!!***********<br />Changed from 3 stars to 1 star based on the &#34;money back guarantee&#34;<br />I wrote to Maple Holistics asking them about the ingredients and telling them of my experience and was never contacted. I have tried 3 times to speak with someone to discuss this and... well here I am. I'm not happy that they advertise &#34;organic&#34; and &#34;guaranteed&#34; and can't back up either. Will not be buying anything from this line again.

It worked even better when I made sure just to apply the conditioner to the ends of my hair and not the scalp. I don't have a lot of hair, so I only needed about a dime-sized drop, which I rubbed on my hands then smoothed through my hair until it was coated. I let it sit in my hair for another 10 minutes or so while I completed my shower, then rinsed it out.   658. The short version - My hair is very dry and frizzy and used to be thick and course, but has been thinning significantly as I've gotten older. And after 2 months, my hair is not as thin anymore. I love it and would recommend other give it a try.<br /><br />The slightly longer version - I have very dry, frizzy, wavy hair that has thinned as I've gotten older and became much more broken since I've moved to a house with very hard water a few years ago. It is medium length, about mid-shoulder blades when wet. I've been using this Silk18 conditioner with the the Maple Holistics Hydrate Shampoo for Dry Hair and Flaking Scalp for about 2 months now. I wanted to know how it would work somewhat longer term. I've used some shampoo/conditioners that seem great for the first couple of weeks and then don't work well anymore. Nothing I've tried has worked well for this long, and I've tried things from the inexpensive Garnier Fructis Sleek & Shine to the more expensive Wen Fig and a lot in between. The first thing I noticed after using the Maple Holistics shampoo & conditioner was that it made my hair really soft. It also made my hair feel light and not weighed down. Because of this I think that some of the broken hairs that I have at the front were actually a bit more flyaway at first, but not in the frizzy way they used to be. As time has gone by, my hair is still soft, the flyaway broken hair is slightly (but not a lot) less flyaway, and my hair feels somewhat thicker and fuller at the roots as well as through the length of my hair. I am very happy that I've finally found something that helps my hair look and feel healthier and I'm hoping that it will help with the broken hair as time goes by. I would recommend it to others with dry or frizzy hair. I will update in the future if there is any significant difference in my hair after a few more months.

I became so frustrated at my straw textured hair that I even used apple cider vinegar mixed with filtered water as a rinse. Combine this with nasty, hard water and you can only imagine what a total disaster my long hair was in. It would take me LITERALLY 30 minutes to comb out my hair after all this and I would lose an enormous amount of hair in the process. So I started doing olive oil hair packs once a week...MESSY! And I had to wash my hair 5 times to get all the oil out. Not time effective. I knew there had to be a better solution. So I did what I always do, got on amazon and started reading reviews. This conditioner sounded too good to be true, but I thought at this point it couldn't get any worse-could it?! As soon as it arrived in the mail I tried it. I never put conditioner on my roots, I start applying it about 4&#34; away from my roots down to the end of my hair. After towel drying my hair the true test came...could I pull the comb through the bottom 6&#34; of a small section of hair without it becoming a knotted mess? I couldn't believe it?! I was able to comb the bottom 6&#34; of ALL my hair without tangles! That hadn't happened in over 7 YEARS! I have recommended this conditioner to ALL my friends. You won't be disappointed! If Maple Holistics ever stops making this awesome conditioner I don't know what I'll do.

  737. I have two slight beefs with this product. One, it claims to be homeopathic. There is nothing homeopathic about this product and it is a pet peeve of mine when people throw around that term. Homeopathy is different than naturopathy. Homeopathy is a specific branch of medicine based on the theory that &#34;like cures like&#34;. Please know the meaning of a term before posting it on your product label. (Plus, even if they just said this product was &#34;all-natural&#34; or something, I'd take issue with that as well as there are definitely non-natural ingredients. But I think it's better than most.)<br /><br />My second beef is that the conditioner doesn't go very far. I have short hair (above my shoulders) and I have to use a lot more of this product than I normally do.<br /><br />But, I will say that my hair has been softer and healthier looking and easier to manage since I started using this. And I love the scent, even though I'm sensitive to smells. This conditioner smells pleasant and I love it when I get a whiff of my hair throughout the day. Overall, I'd probably recommend it, and I'll consider buying it again once I run out.

I've been using Nexus Color Assure sulfate-free shampoo for about a month, which I really like, but adding this conditioner has made a noticeable difference. I use a a quarter-size amount and the first time, I left in for about 5 minutes. Since then, I leave it in about 1-2 minutes and then rinse. It comes out of the bottle thick, but dissolves into a slick, almost serum-like consistency when you rub it into the hair. The smell is a soft vanilla, slight coconut smell and it not strong as some reviewers said. Once my hair is dry, I cannot smell it at all. Before this product, I was cleaning hair out of my brush every few days, and now I don't see as much hair loss. The only negative I have is that the bottle is fairly small, so I'm not sure how long it will last. But you can bet, I will be purchasing this again!

  853. This is not a vegan product. This product contains silk amino acids and the majority of silk production is &#34;not vegan and not cruelty free&#34;. The majority of silk production is not vegan and not ethically harvested. Silk comes from the &#34;killed&#34; larvae of silk moths. The large in the cocoons are boiled to death so that the cocoon bodies unravel to produce the silk. Not only are thousands and thousands of larvae killed in the process but silk worms have been inbred for so long that they cannot fly anymore and do not exist in the wild. There are a &#34;few places” that are recently obtaining silk ethically but it is “very&#34; expensive: ex: Ahimsa silk also called Peace Silk from India. At ca. $13/bottle, ask the company where they get their silk. Again: It is definitely not vegan: Read the Product description: &#34;Literally from the silkworm during its process of creating silk....&#34; Whether is it vegetarian and ethically raised, ask the the company where they get their silk protein.

  894. This stuff, jeez. I was SO excited to find a a &#34;natural&#34; conditioner that would make my frizzy, out-of control hair be somewhat more manageable, and it did...but the reason it worked truly sucked.<br /><br />1. This product is not 100% natural. Check out the answer in the Q&A section about ingredients and be sure to expand it (I didn't before my purchase, which was a mistake). Things like &#34;Natural Vanilla Fragrance, Panthenol, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Phenoxyethanol, Potassium Sorbate&#34; are not natural, and some aren't exactly good for you either.<br />2. Yeah it makes your hair more manageable, because it strips it. May have just been me, I don't know, but my thick strands became so thin it was outrageous. And it was so noticeable because I usually wear my hair up in clips (instead of bands) and it would slip out.<br />3. Finally, and this was the deal-breaker for me, it actively made my hair fall out--though only in the shower while rinsing. I did tests using it with different shampoos, replaced it with another conditioner and then tried it again (just to see if I was crazy), but no. This conditioner made my hair fall out in clumps. Clumps! If you've ever dyed your hair at home, you'll know what I mean when I say it was exactly like after that first wash; strands simply ran from my head.<br /><br />So yes, it did make my hair feel nice (silky) and it was more manageable BUT there are risks it seems.
  895. I was concerned if all the positive reviews were legit.... Have used this now for 2 weeks and am impressed! It is a really thick product, a little hard to get just the right amount out of the bottle. Was concerned that it would weigh my hair down, but it didn't. I have fine hair, but a lot of it, so it's hard to find just the right conditioner. Seems to help with frizz. A friend actually commented that my hair looked really good. Love the fact that it has natural ingredients. Would purchase again, and curious to try their other products.
  896. I have a lot of course, dry hair and it used to take quite a bit of product to make it look shiny and moisturized. During pregnancy and breastfeeding, I went completely natural and toxin free. I tried more than a fair share of products for my hair and am so, so happy that I came upon this conditioner. I do not like a product with unnatural fragrance in it as I am sensitive to it and do not want my baby to be around it at all. This conditioner has a very natural vanilla scent to it that does not bother me at all. I actually really like it. It sort of relaxes me in the shower. As far as application - it has a nice, thick consistency, yet it spreads nicely through my long, thick hair. I use a decent, but not too big amount, start on my ends and work my way up, then comb it through and leave on for a couple minutes. With previous conditioners, my hair either felt weighed down or felt completely parched and dry. This one leaves my hair pretty silky and moisturized. I still have to put some natural product in my hair before letting it dry, but I expect that.Out of all of the safe and natural conditioners I have tried, it is the best I have found so far. I have only tried the conditioner and am planning on purchasing again as well as trying a shampoo from Maple Holistics. The only issue I have that almost made me give it 4 instead of 5 stars is that the bottle doesn't give you a whole lot for the price. Considering I only wash my hair 3 times a week, though, it has lasted me longer than it would for most people. I'd love if there were more in the bottle, but, for now, I will continue to purchase.

  939. This item is listed as a low chemical product for hair. I was unable to locate the exact label with a list of ingredients prior to purchasing. I read the customer reviews and the product description. The product has more than just natural ingredients, and in fact contains potassium sorbate. Potassium sorbate damages hair, and I have been advised by my physician to avoid it. To help others who review this product, I am listing the actual ingredients: Water, Aloe Barbadenis Leaf, Cetaeryl Alcohol, Behentrimonium Chloride, Glycerin, Cetearyl Olivate, Sorbitan Livate, Phytokeratin, Proppanediol, Caprylic Capric Triglyceride, Argan Oil, Shea Butter, Certified Organic Blend Pomegranate, Hibiscus, Green Tea and Sea Buckthorn, Silk Amino Acids, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Phenoxyethanol, Potassium Sorbate. I am returning this product and plan to make my own conditioner using organic aloe vera from the organic plant, mixing it with water and spraying on my hair as a detangled

She's going to love hearing about this stuff - and she buys quite regularly for her shelf products from Amazon (so I hope they keep plenty in stock!)<br />Anyway, if you, like me, don't mind spending a little extra as long as you get what your paying for, give this a try!

  988. I like holistic products because they don't include loads of toxic chemicals that can cause skin irritation or an allergic reaction. This product does contain many moisturizing products, but nothing toxic or particularly worrisome. The formula is safe enough to use on my delicate scalp, and it leaves my hair feeling moisturized but not particularly weighed down or sticky. The scent is of vanilla and almonds, sweet but not overpowering, so you actually like how it leaves a soft and gentle aroma. The formula is thick enough as to not be runny, and it still spreads evenly and smoothly throughout my wet hair. You don't need very much of the product, a nickel size is usually enough to coat my hair, so this product will hopefully last me months.

I'm going to use a deep conditioner once a week from now on and use whats worked for me in the past instead of wasting my money on things like this. I would really advise anyone to look through reviews by star ratings, don't just go through the first couple of pages and see all 5 star ratings and think its a great product, most of these reviews were probably done positively to get the free product. There's definitely negative reviews out there from people like me who would rather have their money back than endorse something that doesn't work. About 2 minutes on while in the shower and rinse out with cool water. I alternate using it as a leave-in conditioner but this may not work for everyone, so test it first on your hair type.<br />A cold rinse is recommended as well as adding a little to your paddle brush to help with brushing out all the snarls without pulling or damaging the hair when wet. I allow my hair to dry naturally to avoid heat damage and to reduce and further frizziness. I have been using it for 3 week now and it has become my new favorite. After rinsing out my old shampoo, I applied a quarter size of this conditioner throughout the body of my hair and then a little more at the ends. It had a concentrated but pleasant vanilla scent to it. I left it on for 5 minutes, then rinsed it out with cold water. I dried my hair by squeezing moisture out with a towel. Then, I let it airdry. A few months ago I decided I am going to let it grow out again and have a pony tail like most of the old retirees I see around. Well, it didnt take long to find out my hair was not what it used to be. As soon as it got a little longer it was all frizzy and dried out, looked terrible, I thought about going to get a hair cut and forget about the pony tail. My daughter came over and said your hair is all dried out from using that degreaser of a shampoo you use. So I went and bought a organic shampoo and started using that. It made a little bit of difference. After a couple of weeks my hair was still dried out. Ok, I am going to let you in on a little secret, I did some research on line about what causes your hair and skin to dry out like it does. And it always comes back to the water you are using to shower or bath in. The water quality in this country is terrible. Depending where you live they could be using Chlorine,Chloramines or Monochloramines to purify the water. Those chemicals you are absorbing while taking a shower dry out your hair and skin big time. And your breathing in the mist into your lungs while taking a shower. (that's bad) I went online and found a shower filter that removed the Chlorine and Chloramines and the heavy metals from my water and installed them onto my shower. Within three days I could feel the difference in my hair and skin. I can not say it enough, These shampoos and conditioners try to put back the natural oils that these chemicals in the water are taking out. Using these good quality shampoos and conditioners along with the shower filter makes a huge difference. I also installed a vitamin c shower head filter with a flexible hose a week after installing the first shower filter after reading about them and what the vitamin c does for your hair and skin. That was like icing on the cake. Even at my age my hair is soft and shinny. I cant believe it. My main filter is the Pelican I purchased on Amazon and the Vitamin c shower head filter I purchased on anther online store, but they do sell them on Amazon. If you decide to purchase a shower filter contact your local water company and talk to the water quality section to find out what they use to purify the water. Then check on the company website of the shower filter you are thinking of buying to see what the shower filter will reduce or eliminate, you might have to call the filter company as they don't always say what they \\"wont\\" filter out. Only a very few will filter out Monochloramines, some water companies use that instead Chlorine. Some use Chloramine and some use both Chlorine and Chloramine like my water company. A lot of the shower filter advertisements descriptions say they will reduce Chlorine but do not mention the other two, If they removed them they would put that in their advertisement. Check before purchasing, you might think that the filter you bought is protecting you when in reality it is not filtering anything.﻿

I think part of the problem is that there is keratin in this conditioner which is great (makes hair shinier, stronger) but for some people if you use this conditioner more than once a week it will be drying for you. It really depends on your hair type. For some people this would be better as a supplementary conditioner, for others (like me) three times a week works well.

  1186. So I never just randomly write reviews unless I'm going to be getting something in return for it. I don't take care of my hair...at all. I brush it maybe once a month (it's straight anyways), and for special occasions I might straighten it (maybe max. 10x/yr). I also get it bleached/dyed blonde (my hair is normally black), and I know what you are picturing, overall it's just not that pretty usually. I usually get my hair cut twice a year if I can (I have 4 children, 2 xl dogs, a cat, husband, and not to mention attempting to go to school full-time to one day become a doctor...obviously I would go more, but time and money are both tight. So, without more gruesome details, I can definitely tell when it's time for a haircut. This starts around month 3 post haircut. I can feel it. Oops, a few more gross details about my hair and habits. My hair is really thick, but thinning as I have this disorder Trichotillomania (a hair-puuling disorder). I dont necessarily pull it out, but i individually pick hairs that feel just gross and feel their texture. So if you can imagine an unsanded piece of wood, and you ran your fingers over it, you can feel it or maybe even get some splinters! Now try running some fabric over it and sure to get snagged. My hair does this when I pull. I've tried putting it up, even in a bun, but my fingers always find a way in there to the attempting to feel the texture of the individual, thick and splitter hairs. If I take my bun out, it almost stays because my hair had gotte so frizzy and tangled in the process. It's a nasty habit, and the more I pull, eventually some get pulled out, or pull others out in the tangling process. It's a nasty habit I do when I feel it and/or stressed. Well, I try to use natural products on my hair when I can, and stuff like &#34;wen&#34;. I knew it was getting bad, and my hair was getting worse and worse. I looked up conditioner on Amazon, looking for one with zero sulfates (I don't even know if that's strictly a shampoo thing or conditioner as well). This one had great reviews. I got this (and several other stuff from &#34;the amazon&#34;) yesterday. And I tried it today. I didn't leave it on that long either because here in California we are in a drought so I try to limit my showers to 5 minutes. It's not that gross. I just start by washing my hair with shampoo, rinse, wet my loofah and turn the shower off. Then I put conditioner in and let that sit while I put soap on my loofah and lather. Then I rinse. Well, it's dry right now as I type and am absolutely amazed by it. It feels smooth and straight. I can't find any textured hairs. It isn't frizzy or dry, but truly like silk. I'm not sure if hair ever gets used to a product and then loses effectiveness, but if it doesn't, I will be using this conditioner for life.thing or conditioner as well). This one had great reviews. Update: Maple Holistics refunded my purchase 100%.I have a bad reaction to silicones: my skin gets small red welts, and I bought this because it's been touted as silicone-free, and I didn't see any ingredients that are in my list of silicones, but within 10 minutes of using this product, I got my classic silicone-related welts and had to strip my entire body and head with a harsh cleanser to remove it. Maybe there's another ingredient that causes the same reaction as silicones in this. Aside from that, it smells great, and I wish I could use it. I'm not giving a bad review because I think the quality is bad.

It does, however, smell thick and putrid. How can this be? How can a product smell both vanilla and putrid? Maple Holistics accomplishes this. Usually the only reason to add aroma is to cover up another smell, which might be the only way to screw up a vanilla smell. In reality removing a smell by dominating it with something else really just enhances both. They would be better off letting their customers use cologne or perfume for their aromatic needs. It is embarrassing to have someone else smell my hair with this product in it. Still, it does, actually, work, so while I am looking for another product I will not yet rule out Maple Holistics. They need to provide this product without the radioactive odor.

  1279. I've been using this conditioner for about 4 months now and I absolutely love it! I have wavy-curly hair (in terms of length, it's about 3-inches below shoulder-length right now, when dried and curly) and I'm long overdue for a haircut (it's probably been about 6 or 7 months since I got one). And I know, I know...I should get my hair trimmed more regularly, but it's such a pain finding a reasonably-priced stylist, who also knows how to deal with curly hair, that I tend to judge when I need to bite the bullet and get a cut, by when my ends become completely unmanageable and unstylable.<br /><br />I mention all this, because about a month or two after I got my most &#34;recent&#34; haircut, I realized that I was already having problems keeping my hair styled not at my ends, but at my roots! Which definitely were NOT dried or damaged. At this point, I had been using Tresemme's curly hair conditioner for years, but decided it was time to test out new hair products, to see if that could help with this issue. I stumbled on Maple Holistics while doing some online Christmas shopping last year, and decided that it was worth a shot to splurge on a more natural product, even if it wasn't specifically a curly-hair product.<br /><br />Flash forward 4 months to today, and I am SO glad that I decided to test out this conditioner. Even though I DEFINITELY need to get a cut soon, I'm having no problem styling my curls, which still appear relatively undamaged. Best of all, my hair just looks and feels incredible now! This conditioner has made my hair unbelievably soft, and now I even find that after I shower, my hair has that hair commercial-like shininess to it (which I honestly thought only straight-haired women got). Overall, my hair now looks better, my scalp feels healthier (I've started having less trouble with dandruff, which tends to be an issue for me in the Spring and the Fall), AND my curls are much easier to style. In fact, I've found that since I started using this conditioner, my curls keep their shape for much longer, so now I'm able to avoid drying-out my scalp (and my curls) with too many washes in a week. Plus, I've also started getting tons of compliments from friends about how good my hair looks, since I started using this product.<br /><br />I'd say, that only downside about this conditioner is that the bottle is a little bit small. I have to pretty carefully ration-out my conditioner-use when I'm in the shower, but on the plus side, this stuff is so creamy and nourishing, that I don't have to use as much on my roots as I used to, when I was using other conditioners.<br /><br />Also, another slight note: if you don't like sweet-smelling products, it will take a few uses to get used to this product's smell. I'm really NOT into super &#34;feminine&#34; odors (for instance, floral, fruity, or cookie-based scents in perfumes or body products...they either make me want to gag or track down a bakery, because why on earth would you want to smell like a cookie or cinnamon roll, unless you have constant access to those desserts???) and this conditioner DOES smell like vanilla. Normally, I would hate this in a body/hair product, and it was a bit overly sweet-smelling for me the first few times I used it, but I've also gotten used to the aroma and I don't mind it anymore. In fact, the vanilla scent is only a bit strong while your using the conditioner in the shower, but afterwards, the scent becomes very subtle and I don't smell it at all, once I put in my other hair products.<br /><br />All in all, I would wholeheartedly recommend this conditioner to anyone with wavy-curly hair, or just more generally, to anyone with dry hair. It will definitely help to condition your scalp and, if you are a sometimes-dandruff sufferer, like I am, the combination of this conditioner with the occasional use of any tea-tree oil shampoo, should really help to get rid of any dry scalp problems.

But once the winter came, my hair began to get frizzy again so I decided to use a conditioner again. I've used this conditioner for only a few days and I notice how shiny and soft it makes my hair. I disagree with others that say it smells too strong. I have a pretty sensitive nose, but this scent doesn't bother me. In fact, I really like it. It's a light warm vanilla smell that fades away pretty quickly. I'm excited to try their other products in the near future. EDIT: My first purchase and the above review was from 2014 and I've tested several conditioners throughout the years, but this is the only one that makes my hair this soft and frizz-free. 3 years later and I'm still using it. That really shows what a great product this is!

  1432. I actually bought this and the Winter Blend Shampoo and I have fallen in love with both. I have long, fine hair and most conditioners weigh my hair down so I was forced to use other styling products to boost volume. I have to say that this conditioner is the best I have ever used. It only take a small amount (a little less than the size of a quarter) of shampoo and conditioner to lather up my entire head and my hair is to the middle of my back. I don't even use any styling products on my hair anymore and I can go a day between washes, which was never the case with other brands. The shampoo has a minty smell but is not overpowering and the conditioner is a nice light smell that reminds me of coconut. I typically lather shampoo and let it sit for a few minutes while I shower then I rinse and condition. I usually don't even let the conditioner sit for more than a minute before rinsing and it still conditions very well without leaving my hair weighed down and greasy. I am so happy with this shampoo I will definitely continue using it, my hair is softer and shinier that it ever has been. I also have my hair highlighted and I have noticed that my highlights do not seem to fade out as they did in the past. I know the bottles may seem small for the price, but this bottle has lasted me for 2 months--a little goes a long way.

I started to use Shea Moisture Products about a year ago and they did help some but I realized they would often leave a residue in my hair and I had to keep cycling their different lines in order to help maintain its benefits. Then, after very scrutinized and careful research and reading of hundreds of consumer reviews, I came across Maple Holistics. I am in awe! When I applied the shampoo is was light weight but did the job of making my scalp feel clean and hydrated, a refreshing feeling, and very easy to rinse out. Then came the miracle worker the &#34;Silk 18&#34; natural conditioner, this stuff is incredible. Mind you, I hve tried WEN and Shea moisture and never has my hair been instantly de-tangled and moisturizer! I typically have to comb my hair in the shower to maximize he de tangling of conditioner, but not with this one! All I did was apply and in about 10 seconds I could effortlessly run my fingers through my hair. Then let it sit and rinse and done. Refreshed, hydrated, moisturized hair, minus the residue. I'm excited about this new product please give it a try. Treat your hair well, it really can add or take away from your overall appearance and overall self esteem. I will be back to post a picture. Sometimes when I see 1 star reviews with so much negativity I'm a little suspicious that maybe its a competitor writing false reviews but I don't think so in this case. After combing my tangled hair out I really had more split ends. I hardly return Amazon products bc it seems more trouble then it's worth, &#34;It's just conditioner guys, just finish it up&#34; but I'm actually returning this. Yep. The vanilla scent wasn't so overpowering and awful, it was totally tolerable. This is a crappy conditioner covered with marketing buzzwords to makes one feel crunchy and environmentally aware. I can pat myself on the back but I can't comb my hair. Maybe this is why so many in this sustainable community have dreadlocks.. Anyway, amazing marketing by Maple Holistics, under performing product. Maybe it works better on somebody with short hair but def not for me.

  1629. I received the Silk18 conditioner in the mail yesterday and used it last night for the first time. My hair is extremely thick, and as a consequence, can get very frizzy. It's medium length - about two inches below my shoulders - and I heavy bangs. My issue with other conditioners has always been that when I've used them my hair has felt slimy and heavy - like the product was weighing down my hair. Also, my top layer of hair always seemed to be moisturized but the bottom layer - especially at the nape of my neck - remained slightly brittle and would tangle very easily. I've been looking for a natural conditioner without many chemicals to use on my hair. After reading the reviews and researching, I decided to order Silk18 from Maple Holistics. I'm glad I did. As I said before, I've only used it once, but already my hair feels soft to the touch, light, moisturized, not greasy AND the bottom layer no longer feels brittle. I didn't have time to blow dry my hair last night and fell asleep with it slightly wet. When I woke up, I was expecting a monstrous beehive. Instead, my hair was laying soft and shiny. If this is how one use looks like than I cannot wait to see what my hair looks like in a month. I'm also using a natural, sulfate free shampoo in combination and I would recommend everyone do this. We need to move away from chemicals and stick to what our hair and bodies need: natural ingredients that moisturize and protect.   1640. Hands down the BEST non-greasy, no residue, detangling conditioner ever!!!! I have bra band length coarse, thick, naturally curly, dark brown hair that has been highlighted for the past two years and is now mostly blonde. I also ride along on our motorcycles and drive the convertible and let my hair blow freely in the wind. I've also been known to wake up after a long night with some pretty significant 'bed head'. Several days of the week my hair will literally be matted into clumps that I cannot even pull apart with my fingers, let alone think about getting a brush through. After trying waaaaayyy too many conditioners, I had finally resolved myself to an over the counter brand that if I used half cup at a time, I could manage to work through and detangle my hair in about 10 minutes in the shower. Then, the last two times I've had my hair colored, my stylist suggested he do a deep conditioning treatment to help strengthen my hair. Well, this got me thinking that instead of spending $25 on salon treatments, I could probably find something I could use at home. After reading the reviews, I decided to try Silk 18 and one other brand and from the first time I used it, I was in LOVE. This is simply the best conditioner I have ever used. It not only detangles my hair, but doesn't leave any sort of greasy film behind that weighs my hair down. I am truly amazed by this product! I only wish I could buy it by the gallon!

I am not sure why some seem to have great results with this conditioner and others, like me, have terrible results. Perhaps it depends on hair type (mine is baby fine and naturally wavy/curly), or water source. I live in Kentucky where the water contains a lot of calcium. Wish it had worked for me like some of the rave reviews I read before purchasing. I would suggest trying to get a sample of this product to test on your hair before purchasing a whole bottle.

I had resigned myself to the no-'poo method, which was removing my blonde highlights, but when I recently returned to Florida and had to go back to using the horrible chlorine/chloramine-treated water here, no-'poo just wasn't working any more... and my scalp was irritated and itchy, to boot. I am a total canary and react to just about any chemical anything you can think of (with itching, rashes, acne: not fun), so I am always leery of trying new products.<br /><br />I decided to try Maple Holistics, based on all the positive reviews here, and am SO HAPPY I did! The difference in my hair texture and comb-ability is amazing!! Even with the terrible water here, I can brush right through my hair without any ripping, so I don't end up with a brush full of hair. when I am finished. Also, my scalp and nearby skin (neck, face, and upper back) are happy: no more itching or breakouts. Love this stuff and am definitely going to try one of their shampoos next.<br /><br />If you have sensitive skin (and/or scalp) and fine, snarly hair that is terrible to brush out, I highly recommend you try this stuff. My usual hair routine (for my long, course, curly/wavy hair) is to wash w/ diluted Dr Bronner's soap, apply conditioner and rinse, and then use some of the same conditioner as a leave-in when I get out of the shower, and let my hair air dry. Silk 18 made my hair shiny, and it helped the curls clump better than the other brand I was using, but it also made my hair kinda stiff and crunchy. I used it a couple times, with no improvement on the stiffness.<br /><br />Since Silk 18 made my curls defined and shiny, but not soft, and the Tresemme made my hair soft but undefined and not particularly shiny, I decided to combine the two. I used the Tresemme in the shower, and Silk 18 as a leave-in afterwards. I really liked the result, my hair looked better than when I used either of them by themselves.<br /><br />Overall, I did not find Silk 18 to be a good conditioner, hence the 3 stars. It is, however, a good leave-in or curl cream type product for my hair. I would consider buying it again for this purpose, but it will depend on how long I can get the bottle to last cause it is a little expensive for my non-existant beauty budget.

  1741. Last January when I first stumbled across this product, I was very skeptical due to all the great reviews but decided to go ahead and give this conditioner a try. Boy, was I surprised! It seemed to be the &#34;where has this been all my life?!&#34; type of product. It tamed the worst of my frizz, made my hair oh-so-soft, and completely detangled my hair. It smelled of vanilla, but was not too strong for my liking. I shower 4 times a week, and this bottle lasted me 2 months (I don't see how some of the other people reviewing it could go through the whole bottle in just 1 week). Seemed like the perfect product ... until I noticed something unsettling. My hair started shedding like it had when I used to use store-bought conditioners (not clumps or anything, but fairly significant). I was using another new product at the time (a shampoo), so I wasn't sure which was causing the problem. Well, I ran out of the conditioner before I ran out of shampoo and, without thinking about it, I re-ordered this conditioner. During the time that I waiting for it to arrive and not using any conditioner, the shedding stopped -- completely. The conditioner arrived today, and since I needed a shower, I used it -- and my hair proceeded to shed again. So, something is definitely wrong. Either there is something in this conditioner that shouldn't be in it, or I am personally sensitive to one of the natural ingredients. I really wish I could give this 5 stars -- I loved it for so many reasons (which is why I'm not giving it 3 stars)! But I can't give it 5, and I can't keep using something that makes my hair shed. :-( So, I will also not purchase it again. And I will be looking for something else to condition my hair with. Sigh. The hunt continues.
